questions.question: I have ……………………. doubts.
questions.description: Use a few to refer to a small number.

questions.question: She is junior ………………………… me.
questions.description: Use to after junior, senior, inferior, superior etc.

questions.question: No other language is  ……………………….. as Chinese.
questions.description: Use the positive adjective in the construction as...as...

questions.question: This is ……………………. than that.
questions.description: Cheaper is the comparative form of cheap.

questions.question: …………………………… knowledge is always a dangerous thing.
questions.description: A little indicates a small quantity.

questions.question: Of the two routes, this is ……………………………
questions.description: The comparative is used to speak of two things.

questions.question: I have ……………………… knowledge of politics.
questions.description: Little knowledge means almost no knowledge.

questions.question: This material is superior ……………………………… that.
questions.description: Use to instead of than after superior, inferior etc.

questions.question: He is ……………………………… of the three brothers.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare one person or thing with the whole group to which they belong.

questions.question: We are not as rich as ……………………………
questions.description: Object pronouns are more common after as and than.

questions.question: ……………………….. Indians speak English.
questions.description: Use many before a noun without a determiner.
